title: Exponential and Logarithmic - End Behavior - Part A

content.question: Part A (i) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> increase without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit. (ii) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> decrease without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

frqParts.text: Part A (i) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> increase without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit. (ii) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> decrease without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
